body: MMerlin, It is generally recommended that you include some type of mass in your EP materials.  The NoMass material is really only there for when you have no idea what the heat capacity and density of your wall material is but you know that it's very light and you are ok with disregarding the mass.  So go for Option 2, especially if you know the heat capacity and density. I checked your file and I see that you have no heating load because you have set the heating design day temperature setpoint to always be 0 degrees Celsius, which never happens on the design day of your Italian EPW: [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/21oynV1A7zLmRvNm16fgjypuwMG1O6hjugs08loVtNqRJ07YEvn8YVi*ZLFqHa5JQpt4Dee7GkQ8nU0FD9-NyuBgwRGkk2wc/zeroDegHeatingSetpt.JPG) If you change the setpoint to something more reasonable, you will get a heating load out of the simulation. -Chris
